newsitem.title: ITALY: Court hearing for Italy's PM Prodi opens.
newsitem.headline: Court hearing for Italy's PM Prodi opens.

text.p: A committal hearing to examine a prosecutor's bid to try Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi for alleged abuse of office and conflict of interest began behind closed doors in a Rome court on Wednesday.
The request relates to events in 1993 when Prodi was chairman of the huge state holding group IRI.

The prosecutor, Giuseppa Geremia, alleges that Prodi and five other IRI board members at the time awarded an "unjust advantage" to a little-known southern Italian consortium, Fis.Vi., in its purchase of food company Cirio.
Prodi, who has led a centre-left coalition since last May, denies any wrongdoing and has said he does not intend to resign. Neither he nor the others involved attended the hearing.

Legal sources said judge Edoardo Landi was likely to adjourn the hearing to a later date during Wednesday's opening proceedings because a lawyer for one of the defendants is absent at a trial in the northern city of Turin.
